name: Cordyceps (Cordyceps sinensis, Cordyceps militaris)
summary: A medicinal fungus traditionally used in Chinese medicine for energy, endurance, and vitality; studied for fatigue, mood, and metabolic health.
description: Cordyceps is a genus of parasitic fungi used in traditional Chinese and Tibetan medicine. The most studied species include Cordyceps sinensis (now Ophiocordyceps sinensis) and Cordyceps militaris. It is valued for its adaptogenic, immunomodulatory, and energy-boosting properties. Bioactive compounds like cordycepin and polysaccharides are thought to enhance mitochondrial function, oxygen utilization, and stress resilience. Modern research explores its role in fatigue, mood regulation, neuroprotection, and metabolic health.

metadata.natural_source: Fruiting body and mycelium of Cordyceps species
metadata.fda_status: Dietary supplement (not FDA-approved as a drug)

sections.text: Cordyceps contains bioactive compounds such as cordycepin, polysaccharides, and adenosine derivatives. These compounds enhance mitochondrial ATP production, improve oxygen utilization, modulate immune response, and reduce oxidative stress. Neuroprotective actions are mediated by antioxidant and anti-inflammatory pathways, which may support mood and cognition.

adult.note: Traditional use involved whole fruiting bodies; modern supplements use cultured mycelium or extracts.

sections.text: Onset: gradual, over weeks; Duration: sustained with continuous use.

serious: Possible immune overstimulation in autoimmune conditions

other: Quality varies widely between products; authenticity and standardization important.
Wild Cordyceps sinensis is rare and expensive; most supplements use cultivated forms.

sections.geriatrics: Generally well tolerated; sometimes used for vitality in older adults

sections.text: No taper required; can be discontinued without withdrawal.

items: Cordyceps CS-4 extract is most commonly studied in clinical research.
May synergize with other adaptogens like Rhodiola or Panax ginseng.
Used in integrative approaches for fatigue and recovery from chronic illness.
